<<<<<<< HEAD
Christs Last Supper or the doctrine of the Sacrament of Christs Supper, set forth in fiue sermons Wherein is taught the great necessitie of a godly preparation, before men come to the Sacrament. Wherein it doth consist: with the condemnation threatned against the vnvvorthy receiuer of the same. By Samuel Smith, minister of Gods word at Prittlewell, in Essex. Christs Last Supper. Smith, Samuel, 1588-1665.
[32], 357, [1] p.
Printed by T. D[awson] for Iohn Bellamie, and are to bee sold at the South entrance of the Royall Exchange, London : 1620.
Printer's name from STC. Imperfect; lacks pages 177-178. Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
=======

Printed by T. D[awson] for Iohn Bellamie, and are to bee sold at the South entrance of the Royall Exchange, London : 1620.
